result.execSummary:
The defendant Allen Michael Carstensen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Allen Michael Carstensen is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Allen Michael Carstensen was found guilty of Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant to pay at 25% of wages.
Defendant to pay at 25% of wages.

May be served under the Huber Law as long as the defendant reports and remains alcohol and controlled substance free. Defendant maybe allowed to travel into the States of Wisconsin, Illinois and Iowa for employment if permitted by jail rules.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Allen Michael Carstensen, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel Adam Thomas Witt.
Gary L. Luhman appeared as prosecuting attorney. Defendant will enter no contest plea to count #2 with the repeater withdrawn.   Court advises defendant of rights.  Elements stated  Factual basis found.  State complied with Victim Witness Notification. Court sentences the defendant to 1 year in the county jail with credit for 234 days.
